NmeaMessageFormat
NmeaMessageFormat

Defines a NMEA message format.

MAX_MESSAGES

Maximum number of configurable NMEA messages

SentenceType

NMEA sentence type options

GGA

0x01 - GPS System Fix Data

GLL

0x02 - Geographic Position Lat/Lon

GSV

0x03 - GNSS Satellites in View

RMC

0x04 - Recommended Minimum Specific GNSS Data

VTG

0x05 - Course over Ground

HDT

0x06 - Heading, True

ZDA

0x07 - Time & Date

MSRA

0x81 - MicroStrain proprietary Euler angles

MSRR

0x82 - MicroStrain proprietary Angular Rate/Acceleration

Talker

NMEA talker ID options

IGNORED

0 - Talker ID cannot be configured for the given sentence type

GNSS

1 - NMEA message will be produced with talker id "GN"

GPS

2 - NMEA message will be produced with talker id "GP"

GALILEO

3 - NMEA message will be produced with talker id "GA"

GLONASS

4 - NMEA message will be produced with talker id "GL"

MAX_FREQUENCY

NMEA message output is limited to either the MAX_FREQUENCY or the source descriptor set base rate, whichever is lower.

NmeaMessageFormat
NmeaMessageFormat()

Creates a NmeaMessageFormat object.

NmeaMessageFormat
~NmeaMessageFormat()

sourceDataClass
void sourceDataClass(
MipTypes::
DataClass 
dataClass,
uint16 
baseRate
= 
0
)

Sets the source MipTypes::DataClass

Note: if the previously set sampleRate is no longer valid, it will be updated to the closest valid sample rate.

Parameters
dataClass
MipTypes::DataClass

the MipTypes::DataClass source

baseRate
uint16

the base rate of the specified data class. This can be read from InertialNode::getDataRateBase.

sourceDataClass
MipTypes::DataClass sourceDataClass() const

Gets the source MipTypes::DataClass

Returns
MipTypes::DataClass

the source data class for this NMEA message configuration

sampleRate
void sampleRate(
SampleRate 
rate,
uint16 
baseRate
 = 
0
)

Sets the output sample rate. If baseRate is not specified, please use a SampleRate with RateType of decimation (SampleRate::Decimation(rateDecimation)) otherwise it will cannot be properly interpreted.

Note: the sample rate is limited to either the data class base rate or MAX_FREQUENCY (10 Hz), whichever is lower. If input is too high, it will be automatically reduced to the max value.  Sample rate can only be validated if base rate is specified.

Parameters
rate
SampleRate

the SampleRate at which to output

baseRate
uint16

the base rate of the specified data class. This can be read from InertialNode::getDataRateBase.

sampleRate
SampleRate sampleRate() const

Gets the configured output SampleRate

Returns
SampleRate

the output sample rate for this NMEA message configuration

)
